title: Turkana Food Inc. Recalls Aleppo Tahini Sesame Paste 1lb (16oz) Because of Possible Health Risk
content: Turkana Food Inc. Kenilworth, NJ is recalling 858 cases OF Aleppo Tahini Sesame Paste because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system
contentSnippet: Turkana Food Inc. Kenilworth, NJ is recalling 858 cases OF Aleppo Tahini Sesame Paste because it has the potential to be contaminated with Salmonella, an organism which can cause serious and sometimes fatal infections in young children, frail or elderly people, and others with weakened immune system

title: Living with Long COVID
content: People with post-COVID conditions and those who support them can find ways to help, ways to cope with stress, and additional resources and support groups.
contentSnippet: People with post-COVID conditions and those who support them can find ways to help, ways to cope with stress, and additional resources and support groups.

title: Long COVID Basics
content: Learn about the potential COVID-19 long-term effects, including fatigue, shortness of breath, brain fog, chest pain, headache, and other symptoms.
contentSnippet: Learn about the potential COVID-19 long-term effects, including fatigue, shortness of breath, brain fog, chest pain, headache, and other symptoms.

title: COVID-19 Testing: What You Need to Know
content: Learn about testing for COVID-19, including the types of tests, who should get tested, how to get tested, and print resources in English and Spanish.
contentSnippet: Learn about testing for COVID-19, including the types of tests, who should get tested, how to get tested, and print resources in English and Spanish.

title: COVID-19 Vaccines for People Who Are Moderately or Severely Immunocompromised
content: Learn CDC recommendations for COVID-19 vaccines for moderately to severely immunocompromised people. An additional dose is recommended.
contentSnippet: Learn CDC recommendations for COVID-19 vaccines for moderately to severely immunocompromised people. An additional dose is recommended.

title: COVID-19 Vaccine Effectiveness
content: COVID-19 vaccines authorized for use in the U.S. are working well based on studies that have looked at how vaccines work in real-world conditions.
contentSnippet: COVID-19 vaccines authorized for use in the U.S. are working well based on studies that have looked at how vaccines work in real-world conditions.

title: Overview of COVID-19 Vaccines
content: Find an overview of the different COVID-19 vaccines available in the United States, including safety information and the ingredients of each vaccine.
contentSnippet: Find an overview of the different COVID-19 vaccines available in the United States, including safety information and the ingredients of each vaccine.

title: Allergic Reactions after COVID-19 Vaccination
content: If you get a COVID-19 vaccine and think you might be having a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis), seek immediate medical care by calling 911.
contentSnippet: If you get a COVID-19 vaccine and think you might be having a severe allergic reaction (anaphylaxis), seek immediate medical care by calling 911.

title: COVID-19 Vaccine Safety in Children and Teens
content: Read about the clinical trials, research, and ongoing safety monitoring that has shown that the COVID-19 vaccination is safe for children and teens.
contentSnippet: Read about the clinical trials, research, and ongoing safety monitoring that has shown that the COVID-19 vaccination is safe for children and teens.

title: Data & Surveillance
content: Find COVID-19 data and surveillance, including the COVID Data Tracker, hospitalization data, serology surveillance, forecasting, and variant surveillance.
contentSnippet: Find COVID-19 data and surveillance, including the COVID Data Tracker, hospitalization data, serology surveillance, forecasting, and variant surveillance.

title: Bust Myths and Learn the Facts about COVID-19 Vaccines
content: Learn the facts about the authorized COVID-19 vaccines and bust common myths. CDC recommends eligible people age 5 and older get vaccinated.
contentSnippet: Learn the facts about the authorized COVID-19 vaccines and bust common myths. CDC recommends eligible people age 5 and older get vaccinated.

title: Benefits of Getting A COVID-19 Vaccine
content: Learn about the benefits of COVID-19 vaccination based on what experts currently know. Vaccination is an important tool in stopping the pandemic.
contentSnippet: Learn about the benefits of COVID-19 vaccination based on what experts currently know. Vaccination is an important tool in stopping the pandemic.

title: Frequently Asked Questions about COVID-19 Vaccination
content: See answers to FAQs about COVID-19 vaccines, including vaccine safety for kids, during pregnancy, and what to do if you lost your vaccination card.
contentSnippet: See answers to FAQs about COVID-19 vaccines, including vaccine safety for kids, during pregnancy, and what to do if you lost your vaccination card.

title: Vaccines for COVID-19
content: COVID-19 Vaccine: Helps protect you from getting COVID-19 Learn more about getting ready for your COVID vaccine, how to get a vaccine, and what to expect....
contentSnippet: COVID-19 Vaccine: Helps protect you from getting COVID-19 Learn more about getting ready for your COVID vaccine, how to get a vaccine, and what to expect....

title: Coronavirus Disease 2019 (COVID-19)
content: Find links to guidance and information on all topics related to COVID-19, including the COVID-19 vaccine, symptom self-check, data, and other topics.
contentSnippet: Find links to guidance and information on all topics related to COVID-19, including the COVID-19 vaccine, symptom self-check, data, and other topics.

title: How to Protect Yourself and Others
content: Read how to protect yourself from coronavirus and slow the spread, including get vaccinated, wear a mask, and avoid crowds and poorly ventilated spaces.
contentSnippet: Read how to protect yourself from coronavirus and slow the spread, including get vaccinated, wear a mask, and avoid crowds and poorly ventilated spaces.
